name: Dinner Tonight: Seasonal Ratatouille
description: So, I looked in my fridge and noticed that I had: eggplants, bell peppers, squash, zucchini, and tomatoes. That didn't happen on purpose--it's what they had at the farmers' market. But not until my wife said we should have ratatouille...
recipeIngredient: Small handful of parsley and basil

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Place the eggplants in a roasting pan along with 1/4 cup of water and a pinch of salt and pepper. Wrap with aluminum foil, and cook for 25 minutes.

Meanwhile, in a large pot, pour the oil in and turn the heat to medium. Add the onion and saute until light brown. Then crank the heat to high, add the bell peppers, and cook until they start to brown, stirring constantly. Pour in the vinegar and cook for one minute, scraping the bottom with a wooden spoon. Pour contents into a large bowl.

In the now empty pot, pour in 2 tablespoons of oil and turn the heat to medium. Toss in the squash and zucchini and cook until they soften. Then add the tomatoes. Let them begin to release their juices. When the liquid starts to simmer, dump the onions and peppers back in and stir in the tomato paste. Toss in the cooked eggplant slices. Bring mixture to a simmer and cook for two minutes, gently stirring contents.
Turn off the heat, sprinkle in the herbs, season with salt and pepper, and serve with some crusty bread.
